topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552185f56368721430d90700#post_552185f56368721430d90700
"@igotnopicks":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552185d96368727c10bb1e00#post_552185d96368727c10bb1e00
And stealing from reviewers, YAY NINTENDO!


"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552185e36368720b9d501100#post_552185e36368720b9d501100
I admit they are, I also love TES and KOTOR, but acting like they were anything but top tier is silly, 

ME1 had bad combat and the side planets needed to be way more linear or smaller, 

ME2 had the problem of failing to wrap up Cerberus as it should have, and those scans were annoying,

ME3 Honestly shouldn't have had side quests at all, instead spending that on more back ground chatter to help make the whole thing feel even more alive, and yeah the ending was shit,

But most games have way bigger flaws,

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5521880463687261ea080f00#post_5521880463687261ea080f00
[bq="SquiggyBomb"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552187d36368724e321f1a00#post_552187d36368724e321f1a00
I guess it's because people don't like fun.[/bq]
I do have to say something about the anti-nintendo movement going on though:
Nintendo has enough money in savings for the next fifty years already saved.  In order to win against Nintendo your movement would have to completely destroy their source of income and then wait fifty years for them to run out of money.

"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552188396368724e9d890900#post_552188396368724e9d890900
You're not going to win dude; they legitimately have too much money to die or in any shape or form be damaged be damaged financially.  They have so much money that they could pull out of gaming and not release any more products and it would take them decades until they ran out of money.

Are you familiar with the concept of "too big to fail"?  Nintendo is too big to lose.
